{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock

}}

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock

}}

{{TranscriptBlock

}}

{{TranscriptBlock

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:14.519
    | text      = So in this next clip, Alex talks about his love of the John Birch Society, which is...
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | text      = I mean, we already know that he loves the John Birch Society, but he doesn't talk about
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:24.279
    | text      = So I find it important to point out when he does.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:54.279
    | text      = I did.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:07.160
    | text      = When Alex talks about people thinking the John Birch Society was crazy, it's because
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:11.480
    | text      = they were.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:12.039
    | text      = Oh yeah, they were fucked up.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:13.559
    | text      = And they weren't just like some kind of, hey, we're cool.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:17.960
    | text      = We just don't like communists type of people.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:20.839
    | text      = They were really, really, really fucked up.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:23.079
    | text      = And if you look at the materials that they distributed, like especially in their early
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:27.160
    | text      = times, it gives you a good example of what they were really about.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:34.039
    | text      = One of the first books that they put out and was sent to all their meetings was this book
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:38.039
    | text      = called the John Franklin Letters.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:40.039
    | text      = And it is a insane, violent fantasy in sort of the same conversation as the Turner Diaries
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:48.680
    | text      = or the Unintended Consequences.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:53.640
    | text      = That sort of militia fantasy of violent revolt against a government that has gotten too collectivist
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:01.799
    | text      = or whatever.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:02.920
    | text      = That is a big piece of their DNA.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:06.680
    | text      = And it was one of the first books that they ever put out and distributed.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:10.920
    | text      = And so when Alex talks about his dad being at least adjacent to the John Birch Society
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:17.000
    | text      = and it being a part of his childhood, it makes it very difficult for me not to imagine that
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:21.400
    | text      = the John Franklin Letters was something that Alex may have had access to when he was a
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:27.559
    | text      = wee boy, which is fucked up because that book is a real serious mess.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:32.599
    | text      = Yeah, it does make sense of his enduring hatred for football and all of those things that
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:42.119
    | text      = sublimate the male desire to kill.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:45.000
    | text      = Because basically what he's doing is living out murder fantasies through these militia
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:50.200
    | text      = books and all that stuff.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:51.799
    | text      = He's angry at those because he doesn't want to sublimate his desire to fight a war.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:57.880
    | text      = He wants to get his murder boner on.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:00.039
    | text      = Yeah, yep.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:01.160
    | text      = There is something to that, probably.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:03.960
    | text      = Probably.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:05.319
    | text      = So, I mean, also the John Franklin Letters, just to give some sense of what it's all about.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:12.440
    | text      = It was written, probably, it's anonymously written, but it was most likely written by
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:16.519
    | text      = a guy named Revilo P. Oliver, who was one of the founding members of the John Birch
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:21.319
    | text      = Society.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:23.000
    | text      = And he had to sort of get out of the group because he was too openly anti-Semitic and
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:27.720
    | text      = too much of a bigot.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:29.720
    | text      = And he would go on to join William Luther Pierce to form the National Alliance.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:35.160
    | text      = And of course, William Luther Pierce was the guy who wrote the Turner Diaries, which inspired
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:41.079
    | text      = Timothy McVeigh to do the whole Murrah Building bombing.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:45.640
    | text      = Right, right, right.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:46.599
    | text      = So good dudes all around.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:47.880
    | text      = And from an interview that I was able to find, Pierce discusses, like, his inspiration for
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:52.519
    | text      = writing the Turner Diaries was Revilo Oliver giving him a copy of the John Franklin Letters,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:58.440
    | text      = which helped him sort of figure out how he wanted to write his book.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:03.799
    | text      = They're all just writing fan fiction of older fan fiction about militias.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:09.640
    | text      = Malicious. It does feel that way.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:12.680
    | text      = And so, like, a lot of that stuff, like, just the idea that it's a benign anti-communist
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:20.279
    | text      = organization that just felt like, eh, we don't like commies, is absurd.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:25.640
    | text      = It, from the beginning, was a deeply fucked up propaganda strategy and also probably had
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:35.960
    | text      = more to do with suppressing workers' rights than it did in its actual opposition to communism.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:42.359
    | text      = Isn't that strange when a bunch of rich people get together?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:46.119
    | text      = There's always a thing that they say they're doing, but man, it sure helps that their businesses
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:50.200
    | text      = are profiting off of it.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:52.200
    | text      = So also, towards the China issue, because Alex seems to be allergic to speaking in specific
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:58.440
    | text      = terms, I can't really know exactly what declassified document from the CIA he's talking
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:30:03.240
    | text      = about that proved that the CIA put Mao into power in 1949.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:30:07.000
    | text      = Was that one of his self-criticisms, that he was allergic to providing specifics?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:30:11.400
    | text      = That is my assessment.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:30:13.000
    | text      = Oh, that one was yours. Okay, all right.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:30:15.240
    | text      = But left with no real alternatives to get to the bottom of it, I just decided to read
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:30:18.920
    | text      = a bunch of the CIA's declassified information from the years around 1949 that involved China.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:30:23.960
    | text      = And spoiler alert, none of them say that they installed Mao.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:30:26.920
    | text      = On July 22nd, 1948, the CIA put out a report titled, The Current Situation in China.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:30:33.079
    | text      = In the report, the situation is described as being not very good.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:30:36.759
    | text      = The support for nationalist Chiang Kai-Shek, quote, is steadily weakening because of the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:30:41.240
    | text      = unsuccessful prosecution of the war under his leadership and his apparent unwillingness
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:30:45.640
    | text      = and inability to accomplish positive reforms.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:30:48.920
    | text      = The report describes increasing instability in the nationalist side of the Chinese Civil
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:30:53.000
    | text      = War, which was unlikely to be something that we could resolve no matter what we did.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:30:58.440
    | text      = The report is not pro-communist or pro-Mao in any way.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:31:02.200
    | text      = It says, quote, the prospect for the foreseeable future in China is at best an indefinite and
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:31:06.920
    | text      = inconclusive prolongation of the Civil War, with the authority of the national government
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:31:11.240
    | text      = limited to a dwindling area in the central and south China and isolated major cities
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:31:16.359
    | text      = in north and northeast China.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:31:18.119
    | text      = The worst prospect is complete collapse of the national government and its replacement
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:31:22.200
    | text      = and its replacement by a Chinese communist-controlled regime under Soviet influence, if not under
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:31:27.079
    | text      = Soviet control, and uncooperative towards the United States, if not openly hostile.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:31:32.119
    | text      = So strange that they would describe the communists coming to power as the worst-case scenario
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:31:36.119
    | text      = in a classified document, if that's exactly what they were working towards.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:31:40.599
    | text      = According to the report's assessment, the U.S. was in a really precarious position.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:31:44.839
    | text      = The U.S. had passed a bill providing aid to Chiang Kai-Shek, but his government was increasingly
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:31:49.720
    | text      = ineffective in facing opposition not just from the communists, but also from within.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:31:54.359
    | text      = Anti-U.S. sentiment had been growing, not only from the communists, with many thinking
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:31:59.000
    | text      = that the U.S. was taking a side in a civil matter in the hopes of turning China into
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:32:03.480
    | text      = a giant colony.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:32:05.000
    | text      = Were the U.S. to increase the aid offered to Chiang Kai-Shek, that sentiment would almost
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:32:09.160
    | text      = certainly have grown, and along with it, anti-Shek resistance.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:32:13.079
    | text      = At the same time, the question of the USSR loomed large.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:32:16.519
    | text      = Increased aid for the nationalists could very easily result in the USSR formally and materially
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:32:21.880
    | text      = supporting the Chinese communists in that civil war, which could get out of hand really,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:32:26.039
    | text      = really easily.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:32:27.559
    | text      = Considering a lot of these variables, the report points out that, quote,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:32:30.920
    | text      = Many Chinese view the U.S. aid program as prolonging the agony of rather than resolving
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:32:36.200
    | text      = the civil war.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:32:37.640
    | text      = That was a sentiment that we couldn't fight, really.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:32:40.119
    | text      = There was not much we could do.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:32:42.519
    | text      = Chiang Kai-Shek was doing a terrible job of running the war, and he was doing a horrible
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:32:46.200
    | text      = job of inspiring his side with a positive vision of what comes after the war.
}}
